title: Valley Forge National Historical Park: Washington's Generals
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People     Washington's Generals                 Washington's Generals        General George Washington had many Generals that filled various roles at the encampment at Valley Forge. Some of these Generals would go on to have long and storied careers in the war. Some of these Generals would give the ultimate sacrifice alongside their men. Below is a list of some of the more prominent Generals encamped here with their soldiers at Valley forge.          Oil painting of Friedrich von Steuben, Charles Willson Peale, 1780. Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts.   General Friedrich Wilhelm von Steuben          Engraving of Jedediah Huntington, by A.H. Ritchie after a painting by Col. Trumbull. Genealogical Memoir of the Huntington Family, 1863, E.B. Huntington.   General Jedediah Huntington          Nathanael Greene by Charles Willson Peale, from life, 1783. Courtesy, Independence National Historical Park.   General Nathanael Greene          Engraving of General Anthony Wayne, Trumbull and Forest, unknown date. Library of Congress, digital library.   General Anthony Wayne          Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert Motier, Marquis De Lafayette by Charles Willson Peale, after Charles Willson Peale, 1779-1780. Courtesy, Independence National Historical Park.  General Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette          Oil painting of James Mitchell Varnum, John Arnold Nelson, 1870. Brown University, Internet Portrait Collection.   General James Mitchell Varnum
